 Seibei Iguchi, a low-ranking samurai, leads a life without glory as a
 bureaucrat in the mid-XIX century Japan. A widower, he has charge of two
 daughters (whom he adores) and a senile mother; he must therefore work in the
 fields and accept piecework to make ends meet. New prospects seem to open up
 when Tomoe, his long-time love, divorces a brutal husband. However, even as
 the Japanese feudal system is unraveling, Seibei remains bound by the code
 of honour of the samurai and by his own sense of social precedences.
 The consequences are cruel.
